intro: Caltha elata, commonly known as the slender goldcup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features delicate, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. Its leaves are typically divided into three parts, giving it a lacy appearance. Caltha elata thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and forest understories.
